programme.title: Under the Cherry Moon
programme.desc: News of a trust-fund beauty (Kristin Scott Thomas) inspires the pianist (Prince) at a hotel in Nice on the Riviera.

programme.title: Graffiti Bridge
programme.desc: The Kid (Prince) and his rock-club rival (Morris Day) disagree about music in a sequel to the 1984 film "Purple Rain."

programme.title: City Hunter
programme.desc: U.S. criminals hijack a cruise ship with a gluttonous private eye (Jackie Chan) aboard who is seeking a magnate's missing daughter.

programme.title: Crime Story
programme.desc: A Hong Kong detective (Jackie Chan) teams with a police veteran (Kent Cheng) to rescue a wealthy businessman from kidnappers.

programme.title: The Slams
programme.desc: Rival prison factions surround a Los Angeles convict (Jim Brown) who has $1.5 million stashed on the outside.

programme.title: Coming Soon to Soul Flix
programme.desc: "Coming To Soul Flix" features "Arena," "The Big Doll House," "Caged Heat," "Assault on Precinct 13," "The Bad Bunch" and others.

programme.title: Coming Soon to Soul Flix
programme.desc: "Coming To Soul Flix" features "Arena," "The Big Doll House," "Caged Heat," "Assault on Precinct 13," "The Bad Bunch" and others.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: The second installment in a special, two-part program featuring James Baldwin.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Featured guest Bill Withers sings hit single, "Ain't No Sunshine" and other selections from his album, "Just As I Am"; young poetess Mae Jackson reads from her own works.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Former heavyweight boxing champion Muhammad Ali; South African born singer Miriam Makeba; the Delfonics; guest-host Nikki Giovanni opens with her Kidnap Poem.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Singer Jerry Butler headlines with his back-up group, Peaches; highlights of their numbers are "Make It Easy on Yourself" and "Brand New Me."

programme.title: Death of a Prophet
programme.desc: Malcolm X, an African American activist, meets a tragic fate after quitting a religious organization that he served for years.

programme.title: Freedom Road
programme.desc: A former slave and soldier (Muhammad Ali) becomes a U.S. senator from South Carolina after the Civil War.

programme.title: Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.: A Historical Perspective
programme.sub-title: Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.: A Historical Perspective
programme.desc: An examination of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s life and his contribution to the U.S. civil rights movement.

programme.title: The Autobiography of Miss Jane Pittman
programme.desc: A 110-year-old former Louisiana slave (Cicely Tyson) reminisces about her life and society from the Civil War to germinating civil rights.

programme.title: Sounder
programme.desc: A sharecropper's (Paul Winfield) wife (Cicely Tyson) keeps the family together after he goes to prison in 1930s Louisiana.

programme.title: Rock and Roll Revue
programme.desc: Vintage clips of great jazz artists.

programme.title: Coming Soon to Soul Flix
programme.desc: "Coming To Soul Flix" features "Arena," "The Big Doll House," "Caged Heat," "Assault on Precinct 13," "The Bad Bunch" and others.

programme.title: The Borrower
programme.desc: The police (Rae Dawn Chong, Don Gordon) follow the work of an alien who borrows and then sheds human heads.
